p: The most abundant constituents in the rhizome essential oil of Z. neotruncatum were perillene (51.3%), neral (12.3%), and geranial (17.0%). Perillene is a major component of Perilla frutescens (perillene chemotype) [ 47] and Elsholtzia polystachya (perillene chemotype) [ 48], but has been found in Zingiber essential oils in small concentrations, e.g., Z. officinale rhizome oil (0.1â€“0.6%) [ 40, 49, 50] and Z. zerumbet leaf oil (1.2%) [ 51]. Neral and geranial are also major components of Z. officinale rhizome oil [ 49, 50].
